original_title: Handbook for Theory, Research, and Practice in Gestalt Therapy
processed_title: Handbook for Theory, Research, and Practice in Gestalt Therapy
content: Many books have been written about gestalt therapy. Not many have been written on the relationship between gestalt therapy and psychotherapy research. The Handbook for Theory, Research, and Practice in Gestalt Therapy is a needed bridge between these two concerns, and a timely addition to scholarly literature on gestalt therapy itself. In 2007 an international team of experienced gestalt therapists devoted themselves to create this book, and they have collaborated with one another to produce a challenging and enriching addition to the literature relevant to gestalt therapy. The book discusses the philosophy of science, the need for research specifically focused on gestalt therapy, and the critical realism and natural attitude found in both research and gestalt praxis. It provides discussions of qualitative and quantitative research, describes the methods of gestalt therapy as based in a unified theory, and illustrates the application of research in the contexts of emerging gestalt research communities. The discussion contained in this book is needed at a time when warrant for the practice of psychotherapy is increasingly sought in the empirical support available through psychotherapy research–the so called evidence-based movement–and at a time when public policy is increasingly driven by the call for “what works.” Philip Brownell, M.Div., Psy.D. is the Director of the Gestalt Training Institute of Bermuda. He is a registered psychologist, organizational consultant, and coach in practice in Bermuda and a licensed clinical psychologist in Oregon and North Carolina, USA. He is the author of Gestalt Therapy: A Guidebook for Mental Health Professionals, consulting editor for The European Journal for Qualitative Research in Psychotherapy and has contributed to numerous books and journals in Australia, the UK, and the USA. He is the founder and facilitator of Gstalt-L, an eCommunity started in 1996 for gestalt therapists, trainers, trainees, theorists, and writers, and he serves on the Board of Directors of the Association for the Advancement of Gestalt Therapy, an international community. This book is the first comprehensive analysis of the psychology of pandemics. The Story Cookbook is a comprehensive collection of over 80 story-based activities. This easy-to-follow guide provides a treasure trove of techniques to apply and adapt. It is a must-read for consultants, educators, and leaders using storytelling for positive change. This book explores the human psyche (‘soul’) and its usefulness in a techno-scientific revolution that is often blind to its subject: the human being. It makes a strong intellectual case for the soul by examining consciousness, synchronicity, suffering, and death. Fractal dynamics provide a tool for understanding complexity. This book brings experts together to reconcile dichotomies like mind-brain and subjective-objective, bringing subjective experience into a scientific framework. summary: Buku *Handbook for Theory, Research, and Practice in Gestalt Therapy* merupakan jembatan penting antara teori terapi gestalt dan penelitian psikoterapi. Dikembangkan oleh tim internasional dari terapis gestalt berpengalaman, buku ini menyediakan wawasan yang komprehensif mengenai filsafat ilmu, pentingnya penelitian khusus terhadap terapi gestalt, serta pendekatan kritis realisme dan sikap alamiah dalam penelitian dan praktik terapi. Buku ini membahas metode penelitian kualitatif dan kuantitatif, serta menggambarkan cara kerja terapi gestalt berdasarkan teori yang terpadu. Selain itu, buku ini menjelaskan bagaimana penelitian dapat diterapkan dalam komunitas penelitian terapi gestalt yang berkembang. Dalam era di mana kepercayaan terhadap praktik psikoterapi semakin memerlukan bukti empiris—dikenal sebagai gerakan *evidence-based practice*—buku ini sangat relevan. Buku ini juga menanggapi kebutuhan akan bukti yang kuat dalam kebijakan publik yang semakin menekankan "apa yang berhasil." Philip Brownell, penulis buku ini, adalah seorang psikolog terdaftar, pelatih, dan penulis yang aktif dalam komunitas terapi gestalt. Sebagai pendiri dan penggerak komunitas *Gestalt-L* sejak 1996, ia berperan penting dalam memperkuat keterhubungan antara teori, penelitian, dan praktik terapi gestalt. Buku ini menjadi kontribusi penting dalam literatur akademik terkini, memperkuat posisi terapi gestalt dalam dunia psikologi modern.
